definition: tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)

sentences.english: Worse than the hunger, say local leaders, is the thirst.
sentences.chinese: 但在当地头领看来，比饥饿可怕百倍的是干渴。

sentences.english: Big Sheep and Small Sheep were tired, hungry and thirsty.
sentences.chinese: 大羊和小绵羊疲倦，饥饿和干渴。

sentences.english: Can die from thirst which gives a new ghost color.
sentences.chinese: 可能死于干渴，有新的鬼颜色。

sentences.english: When your soul experiences thirst, it needs water to quench it, no matter the water is poisonous or not.
sentences.chinese: 心灵感到干渴时需要水来止渴，无论这水是否有毒。

sentences.english: When that hour came to me among the pines, I wakened thirsty.
sentences.chinese: 当那一刻来临，夜宿松间的我从干渴中醒来。

sentences.english: It is food for the hungry of wit and drink to those thirsting for laughter.
sentences.chinese: 它是智慧饥饿时的粮食，是讪笑干渴时的饮料。

sentences.english: Without rain, plants and animals would die of thirst.
sentences.chinese: 没有雨水，动植物就会干渴而死。

sentences.english: Your children know what it feels like to be thirsty.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们知道干渴是一种什么感受。

sentences.english: When it comes to seeking thrill and excitement, parasailing is the best solution for that thirst.
sentences.chinese: 说到寻求刺激和兴奋，伞是最好的解决办法为干渴。

sentences.english: His boastful throat soon grew hoarse with thirst, and he betook himself to prayer.
sentences.chinese: 不久，那夸口的喉咙因干渴而沙哑，他开始祈求。

sentences.english: It is a willow tree alone in acres of dry corn.
sentences.chinese: 这棵柳树生长在一大片干渴的玉米地中。

sentences.english: The people and their crops get thirstier and thirstier.
sentences.chinese: 人们和农作物越来越感到干渴。

sentences.english: For every thirst , there are a hundred lakes.
sentences.chinese: 每一次干渴，等于百个湖水。

sentences.english: Dust dries your throat, leaving an unquenchable thirst.
sentences.chinese: 沙尘使你喉咙发干，让你感到干渴难忍。

sentences.english: Is it simply the warmth of the chicken broth running down a parched and scratchy throat?
sentences.chinese: 是暖暖的鸡汤滋润了干渴沙哑的喉咙？

sentences.english: She lifted the grapey, dark red juice to her parched mouth and drank.
sentences.chinese: 她把葡萄酒，黑红的酒水举到她干渴的嘴上喝起来。

definition: lit. dry mouth and tongue (idiom); to talk too much
(of dry soil, skin etc) to crack/to chap
hungry and thirsty/(fig.) to crave (knowledge, love etc)
